nodes.value: Cambio social
Social change
Transformation in social order/structures in a society
Education can be a powerful tool for social change.
Protestas políticas
Political protests
Public expressions of objection to government policies
Political protests erupted across the country.
Organizar(se)
Organize
Arrange or structure in a systematic way; gather people
They helped organize a community fundraising event.
Gobiernos
Governments
The governing body of a nation, state, or community
People expect governments to provide basic services.
Medios (de comunicación)
Media
Main means of mass communication (e.g., TV, internet)
The media plays a crucial role in informing the public.
Comunidades
Communities
Groups of people living together or sharing interests
Online communities connect people with shared hobbies.
Luchar contra
Fight against
To take action to stop or defeat something
We need to fight against injustice.
Injusto
Unfair
Not based on or behaving according to fairness
It felt unfair that only one person received a prize.
Economía global
Global economy
The interconnected worldwide economic activities
The global economy is affected by events in different countries.
El cambio social ha sido muy importante para las protestas políticas y el cambio social en todo el mundo.
Social change has been very important for political protests and social change around the world.
Grandes grupos de personas ahora pueden organizarse rápidamente para protestar contra los gobiernos y usar los medios para mostrar al resto del mundo lo que está sucediendo.
Large groups of people can now quickly organize themselves to protest against governments and use media to show the rest of the world what’s happening.
Grupos como Occupy Wall Street construyen comunidades en línea que intentan luchar contra lo que ven como una economía global injusta.
Groups like Occupy Wall Street build online communities which try to fight against what they see as an unfair global economy.
Disfrutaba
Enjoyed
Past tense of enjoy; took delight or pleasure in
Her younger brother enjoyed cooking with his new toy.
Cocinar
Cooking
The practice or skill of preparing food
Cooking can be a relaxing hobby.
Horno de juguete
Toy oven
A toy that resembles a real oven for children to play with
She wanted to buy her brother a toy oven.
Regalo
Present
A gift; something given to someone without payment
He received many presents for his birthday.
Diseñado para
Designed for
Created or intended for a particular purpose or person
The toy ovens were designed for girls.
Petición
Petition
A formal written request, typically signed by many people
She started an online petition to the toy company.
Pedir / Solicitar
Asking
Requesting someone to do or provide something
The petition was asking them to make ovens for boys.
Firmas
Signatures
A person's name written in a distinctive way as validation
The petition quickly gathered thousands of signatures.
Empaque / Embalaje
Packaging
Materials used to wrap or protect goods
Hasbro decided to change the packaging for their ovens.
McKenna Pope, de 13 años, vio que a su hermano menor le gustaba cocinar y quiso comprarle un horno de juguete como regalo.
13-year-old McKenna Pope saw that her younger brother enjoyed cooking and wanted to buy him a toy oven as a present.
Buscó en línea, pero descubrió que solo podía comprar hornos de juguete diseñados para niñas.
She went online, but found that she could only buy toy ovens designed for girls.
Decidió iniciar una petición en línea a Hasbro Toys pidiéndoles que hicieran hornos de juguete para niños.
She decided to start an online petition to Hasbro toys asking them to make toy ovens for boys.
En menos de un mes, su petición recibió 45,000 firmas y Hasbro decidió cambiar el empaque de sus hornos.
In less than a month her petition received 45,000 signatures and Hasbro decided to change the packaging for their ovens.
Intimidadores adolescentes
Teenage bullies
Young people who habitually seek to harm or intimidate others
Teenage bullies filmed the school bus driver.
Filmado
Filmed
Past tense of film; recorded an event with a camera
They filmed themselves making him cry.
Conductor de autobús escolar
School bus driver
A person who drives a bus that transports students
The school bus driver was visibly upset.
Llorar
Cry
Shed tears, typically as an expression of distress
The video showed the driver starting to cry.
Subieron (a internet)
Uploaded
Transferred data from one computer system to another
They uploaded the video to YouTube.
Se hizo viral
Went viral
Became very popular by circulating quickly on the internet
The video quickly went viral.
Conmocionado / Impactado
Shocked
Surprised and upset by something unexpected and unpleasant
He was shocked when he saw the video.
Campaña
Campaign
An organized course of action to achieve a particular goal
He started a campaign to raise money for her.
Recaudar fondos
Raise money
Collect money for a particular purpose
The campaign aimed to raise money for a holiday.
Vacaciones / Descanso
Holiday
A period of leisure and recreation away from work
They wanted to give Karen Klein a holiday.
Recibió
Received
Was given, presented with, or paid something
Karen received over $600,000 from the campaign.
Establecer / Fundar
Set up
To establish a business, institution, or other organization
She used the money to set up the Karen Klein Foundation.
Fundación
Foundation
An organization established to provide funds for a cause
The foundation aims to stop bullying.
Detener el acoso
Stop bullying
To prevent or put an end to bullying behavior
The goal is to stop bullying across America.
Lo que sea
Whatever
It doesn't matter what; anything or everything
Whatever your problem is, social media can help.
Cuando unos intimidadores adolescentes en Nueva York se filmaron haciendo llorar al conductor de su autobús escolar, subieron el video a YouTube y se hizo viral.
When teenage bullies in New York filmed themselves making their school bus driver cry, they uploaded the video to YouTube and it went viral.
Max Sidorov, un canadiense de 25 años, vio el video y quedó conmocionado.
Max Sidorov, a 25-year-old Canadian man, saw the video and was shocked.
Él inició una campaña usando las redes sociales para recaudar fondos y darle unas vacaciones a la conductora del autobús, Karen Klein, de 68 años.
He started a campaign using social media to raise money to give the bus driver, 68-year-old Karen Klein, a holiday.
Él quería recaudar $5,000. Sin embargo, en tres semanas la campaña recaudó más de $600,000.
He wanted to raise $5,000. However, within three weeks the campaign raised more than $600,000.
Cuando Karen recibió el dinero, usó $100,000 para establecer la Fundación Karen Klein e intentar detener el acoso en toda América.
When Karen received the money, she used $100,000 to set up the Karen Klein Foundation to try and stop bullying across America.
Así que, sea cual sea tu problema, si usas las redes sociales, ayudarás a la gente que te ayudará a cambiar el mundo.
So whatever your problem is, if you use social media, you’ll help people who will help you change the world.
Condicionales reales
Real conditionals
Sentences describing results of likely/certain situations
Real conditionals often use 'if' or 'when'.
Presente simple
Present simple
Basic tense for facts, habits, scheduled events
'She eats apples' is an example of present simple.
Futuro (con 'will')
Will (future)
Used to express future intentions or predictions
'It will rain tomorrow' uses 'will' for the future.
Consecuencia
Consequence
A result or effect of an action or condition
Every action has a consequence.
Situación
Situation
A set of circumstances
This is a difficult situation.
Probable
Likely
Such as well might happen or be true; probable
It's likely to rain later.
Cierto / Seguro
Certain
Known for sure; established beyond doubt
It is certain that the sun will rise tomorrow.
Cláusula
Clause
A unit of grammatical organization with a subject & verb
A sentence can have a main clause and a subordinate clause.
a) Si usas las redes sociales, encontrarás gente que te ayudará.
a) If you use social media, you’ll find people who will help you.
b) Si recaudamos suficiente dinero, el conductor del autobús no necesitará trabajar más.
b) If we raise enough money, the bus driver won’t need to work any more.
c) Cuando la gente vea lo que está pasando, se sorprenderán.
c) When people see what’s happening, they will be shocked.
d) Las protestas continuarán si no cambian el gobierno.
d) The protests will continue if they don’t change the government.
1 Usa condicionales reales (si/cuando + presente simple + will) para hablar sobre la consecuencia presente o futura de una situación específica.
1 Use real conditionals (if/when + present simple + will) to talk about the present/future consequence of a specific situation.
2 Usa 'if' para una situación que es probable/cierta.
2 Use if for a situation which is likely/certain.
3 Usa 'when' para una situación que es probable/cierta.
3 Use when for a situation which is likely/certain.
4 La cláusula if/when puede estar al principio o al final de la oración.
4 The if/when clause can be at the beginning or the end of the sentence.
